  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, one paper bag of fifty bags on a pallet, of the above described hazardous material was found damaged. It appeared the damage occurred when the bag caught on a strap when it was loaded onto the trailer. Approximately three pounds of the dry substance spilled on to trailer floor. Spill has been cleaned and all damaged material was left in a salvage pail at OSandD.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 17, 2023, twelve (12) one-gallon containers of paint were damaged by a skid steer and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. E3 personnel utilized granular and absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all paint impacted material into one (1) cubic yard bag and was staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023040619
item.description:
Report E-2023040619

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-26T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-10
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: xpo logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 15 gallon pail of paint (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release. 2.2023040620 XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced a UN1263 CAT Black Paint release at a customer location from a 15-gallon metal drum. XPO reported the customer accepted the damaged freight and the trailer floor was currently at the XPO terminal needing cleanup. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup of the trailer floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to an 8' x 3' area of the trailer floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023040230
item.description:
Report X-2023040230

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-26T21:08:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE UNLOAD ON THE TWILIGHT SORT. PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER. PACKAGE WAS SITTING ON IT'S SIDE IN LIQUID. PH TAPE WAS USED TO TEST PH LEVEL. PH WAS AT LEVEL 0. SODIUM BICORBONATE WAS SPREAD ON LIQUID TO NEUTRALIZE. RESPONDER WEARING CORROSIVE PPE PICKED UP AND PLACED PACKAGE AND CONTENTS IN DMP TRAY. RESPONDER USED SODIUM BICARBONATE TO NEUTRALIZE LIQUID UNTIL PH WAS READING LEVEL 7. ZORBENT WAS USED TO CLEAN UP SPILL AND WAS PLACED IN DMP TRAY. ALL MATERIAL WAS TAKEN TO DMN PROCESSING AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 30, 2023, one (1) 325-gallon tote of bisulfites (UN2693) was punctured and released less than one gallon (>1) of product to the top of the tote and concrete surfaces of the concrete dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. E3 personnel performed a tote transfer via gravity transfer into a new 325-gallon tote. The crew then took the one (1) damaged tote for disposal and the new 325-gallon tote was left on site.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-23
  • City: PRESCOTT
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a release from a 1-gallon metal jerrycan during transit. The release occurred on 1-30 westbound at mile marker 46 due to a pallet nail puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released from one 1-gallon metal jerrycan due to a nail puncture. The material was evaporating quickly. The damaged can and impacted cardboard were collected into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Garland, TX for terminal personnel to manage.

The car was released to continue to destination.

item.description:
Report E-2023010415

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T21:08:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-04
  • City: HOPE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Schneider Bulk Carriers
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 04, 2023, Schneider Bulk Carriers contacted ERTS to report a four-gallon spill of regulated UN1993 "Olefin Sulfide" combustible liquid n.o.s that was released during transit. The caller stated that the release came from one liquid bulk tank as a result of mechanical failure and impacted the inside flooring of Trailer #21463 located at the Weight Station of (MM#26) I-30, Hope, AR. Lonestar arrived on site and located the tanker and approximately 4 gallons spilled with only 3 or 4 oz on the ground in a 6" area. The majority of the spill was on the back of the tanker. Lonestar advised that when wiping the tanker, it was smearing around, according to the SDS the product is insoluble, so the crew wiped down the sides of the tanker as well as the brakes and tires with brake cleaner and degreaser. One drum of contaminated rags and pads was generated and properly disposed of on January 17, 2023, at Pleasant Oaks Landfill in Mt Pleasant, TX.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1052 AM ET, XPO Terminal LLR reported a spill that occurred inside a trailer at 1000 AM ET, in Little Rock, AR. The spill consisted of an unknown amount of UN2920 Coagulant 150 RM. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 5' x 6' area due to a forklift blade scraping the side of the drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022120599
item.description:
Report X-2022120599

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T21:08:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-23
  • City: HOT SPRINGS NATIONAL PARK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg arrived here via trailer, loaders unloaded pkg and noticed that it was wet. Pkg sent to QA it was separated from other pkgs and waited until sort was down then brought to me. DescribePack: There is no physical damage to this pkg, upon closer inspection the leak from inside was minor, There are crystals on the tops of the bottles where the contents leaked the box is bleached where the leak was. It appears that the caps were loose, the contents sloshing inside splashed the contents inside the box and on the bottles. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was placed in a HazMat bag and set aside after the lids were tightened.

  • Description: On October 4, 2022, two (2) pails of car wash solution were punctured during loading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to perform the necessary corrective actions. E3 personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all car wash solution-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then overpacked the two (2) damaged pails of product into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T21:08:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-07
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE TWILIGHT SORT. RESPONDER CAME ACROSS A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE TRAILER LEAKING LIQUID FROM CONTAINER. RESPONDER TESTING WITH PH TAPE. LIQUID TESTED AS CORROSIVE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET, WEARING PROPER PPE. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN DMN CONTAINER. LIQUID WAS NEUTRALIZED USING SODIUM BICARBONITE AND ABSORBED WITH OIL DRY. RESPONDER CLEANED UP ALL SPILLED MATERIAL AND PLACE IN DMN CONTAINER. ALL CONTAMINATED PRODUCTS WERE TAKEN TO DMN AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LSD called in to report a spill of UN 1760 Aluminum Brightener from a 5 gallon plastic pail that appeared to be leaking due to a defect where the handle attaches to the pail and was impacting their dock floor. ERTS dispatched Environmental Works to conduct cleanup. At 0008 ET, EW personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 gallons of product released to a 20' x 2' area of the concrete dock floor due to a defective container handle. Oil dri was deployed and worked into the impacted area. The waste was then collected into a 20 gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022080980
item.description:
Report X-2022080980

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T21:08:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-03
  • City: MARION
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Container loaded with 11 pallets of batteries with improper blocking and bracing had a load shift and damaged 47 batteries resulting in an estimated 24 gallons of battery acid releasing inside the container and onto the ground. The blocking and bracing consisted of only 2x6's and a piece of plywood at the rear door. There was approximately 1' between the end of the pallets and the bracing with no pallet cleats. This allowed the pallets to move and shift the load resulting in all pallets having to be reworked due to the shift and overturned batteries.

  • Description: Driver stated Customer normally has tank stuck and gallons that can be unloaded into tank, but today, they didn't provide that. Driver stated you cannot see in the tank to tell if its getting full or not. Paperwork was signed and tank was unlocked, driver believes about 10 gallons spilled down the tank and ran into a trench the customer had dug that goes into a ditch. Driver shut down and believes he is empty, he said he will have to blow his lines out. Driver has attempted to locate site management and make them aware of the spill and ask if they will need assistance with clean up, he took pictures and sent to TM. Driver was released by Twin Pines Management Randy Womack and Gary Maroon

item.title: Report X-2022060546
item.description:
Report X-2022060546

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T21:08:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-22
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During routine tank car inspections, an odor was detected when looking inside the housing. Upon further investigation, it was determined to be a vapor release at the plug on the vapor valve. The valve was fully closed but bubbles were detected at the plug. The plug was backed out, ensured no liquid was present and removed the plug. There was an excessive build up of teflon tape so the plug was cleaned, retaped and reinstalled. Before tightening the plug it was checked again with Snoop and the bubble continued. The leak was able to be stopped with the plug. It appears to be a defective valve leaking by and the shipper was notified and advised to apply for an OTMA. The car was put in hold until the OTMA is granted.
